summary: This document is an email chain from November 2021 regarding the criminal case United States v. Maxwell (20 Cr. 330). It involves legal counsel requesting that Laura Menninger be added to the Electronic Case Filing (ECF) system as a 'movant' to file papers on the docket. The chain includes communications between defense attorneys, the judge's chambers, and a letter submission.

persons.name: Brian T. Burns
persons.context: Attorney from Smith Villazor LLP representing a party and submitting a letter to Judge Nathan requesting ECF access for Laura Menninger.

persons.name: Alison J. Nathan
persons.context: U.S. District Judge presiding over the case United States v. Maxwell (20 Cr. 330). Her chambers are involved in the email correspondence.

persons.name: Bobbi C. Sternheim
persons.context: Defense counsel for Ghislaine Maxwell in the case, copied on the email chain and confirming receipt of a memo from the court.

persons.name: Jeff Pagliuca
persons.context: Attorney copied on the email chain, likely involved in the Maxwell case.

persons.name: Laura Menninger
persons.context: Attorney who is the subject of the request to be added to the ECF system as a 'movant' to file papers in the Maxwell case.

persons.name: Patrick Smith
persons.context: Attorney who authored a letter to Judge Nathan regarding a Rule 17(c) subpoena and is copied on the email chain.

connections.description: Burns is submitting a request on behalf of Menninger to be added to the ECF system, indicating a professional legal association.
Sternheim is defense counsel in the case before Judge Nathan, confirming receipt of court documents.
Burns is submitting a letter authored by Smith to the court, indicating collaboration or representation.

events.title: Court Issues Memo Endorsement
events.description: Judge Nathan's chambers issues a temporarily sealed memo endorsement in the Maxwell case and requests confirmation of receipt from counsel.

events.title: Submission of Rule 17(c) Subpoena Letter
events.description: Brian Burns submits a letter from Patrick Smith to Judge Nathan regarding a Rule 17(c) subpoena in the Maxwell case.

events.title: Request for ECF Access for Laura Menninger
events.description: Brian Burns submits a letter requesting that Laura Menninger be added to the Electronic Case Filing system as a 'movant' to file papers on the docket.

keyFacts: The document is part of the ongoing criminal case United States v. Maxwell (20 Cr. 330-AJN) from November 2021.
Legal counsel requested that attorney Laura Menninger be added to the Electronic Case Filing (ECF) system as a 'movant' to file papers on the docket.
The email chain shows coordination between defense attorneys, the judge's chambers (Judge Alison J. Nathan), and other legal counsel regarding case procedures.
A letter regarding a Rule 17(c) subpoena was submitted by Patrick Smith through Brian Burns, indicating active pre-trial litigation.
The correspondence highlights the formal procedural steps and communications between the court and counsel in a high-profile case.
